title: Nectar eaters
creator_credit: Graham Pizzey, Art Mayer and Comalco Australia
brief_description: The majority of Australia’s 12,000 plant species produce flowers attractive to pollinating agents to ensure the production of fertile seed This film, shot in southern Queensland and northern New South Wales, looks at some of the more important Australian blossom feeders and pollinators including the Sugar Glider, Eastern Pigmy Possum, Scarlet Honeyeater, Rainbow Lorikeet and the Grey-headed Flying Fox.
